coil.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to wind or twist into a series of rings, or to make something do this
coil.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The snake coiled around the branches of the tree.
Her long hair was coiled up in a plait at the top of her head.
coil.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a continuous series of circular rings into which something such as wire or rope has been wound or twisted
coil.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: one ring of wire, rope etc in a continuous series
coil.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a wire or a metal tube in a continuous circular shape that produces light or heat when electricity is passed through it
coil.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: the coil in a light bulb
coil.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: the part of a car engine that sends electricity to the spark plugs
coil.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: a contraceptive that is a flat curved piece of metal or plastic that is fitted inside a womanâ€™s uterus
